channel.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [Global][Hosted Private Cloud] - VCSA upgrade
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 25, 07:00 UTC  -  Jul 28, 16:00 UTC

Jul 14, 01:49 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 25/07/2022 07:00 UTC
End time : 28/07/2022 16:00 UTC
Service impact : Only the VCSA management will be impacted during maintenance. Your VMs will continue to function, as will the hosts, storage and network.
Service improvement: As part of our continuous improvement, we will be updating vCenter Server Appliance.

item.title: [RBX2B][Hosted private Cloud] - Hosted private Cloud hosts and Backup management
item.description:
Jul 19, 18:00 UTC
Update - Update : We are starting to restart the affected datastores. A manual restart of the VMs on the client side will be necessary for the services to be effective.
As a reminder, the return to service will depend on the control of equipments by the technical teams. Our teams are mobilised to restore services as quickly as possible.

Jul 19, 16:02 UTC
Update - Update : Our teams are electrically checking Row B of Room 29.
Following this check and depending on the state of equipments, the datastores will gradually be brought back into service.

Jul 19, 15:44 UTC
Update - Update : Following the recommissioning of Row A, the capacity of the Hosted Private Cloud hosts is comming to returned progressively to normal.
Our team control the resumption of hosts activity to avoid a temperature overload that could lead to an over incident.

Jul 19, 15:07 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: Our teams continue to work on the datastores.

Jul 19, 14:58 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: Veeam service is available again.
Our teams are still working on the unavailable datastores.
We estimate that the whole situation will get back to normal in 24 hours.

Jul 19, 14:35 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: Our teams stopped temporary the Veeam backup service in order to make all the other services available.
We will keep you updated on the situation

Jul 19, 14:08 UTC
Update - Ongoing Actions: Management is gradually coming back.
Our teams are still working to solve the problem

Jul 19, 13:34 UTC
Identified - Start time: 19/07/2022 12:59 UTC
User impact : Management down of some PCCs and backup will fail today for most of RBX customers.
Also datastores on RBX2B might be unavailable.
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2B
Scope of impact : Veeam backup and management of some PCC.
Root cause : A technical problem in our cooling system caused the incident
Ongoing Actions: Our teams are currently working to solve the problem

item.title: [RBX2B][Hosted private Cloud] - Additionnal Zpool
item.description:
Jul 19, 10:35 UTC
Identified - Start time: 19/07/2022 09:47 UTC
User impact : Some zpool are not mounted on the gwssl, sftp access issue.
No impact on the production datastore is detected.
Only requests for additional zpools are affected by the incident.
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2B
Scope of impact : Gateway ssl
Root cause : Incident caused by operation on a maintenance about storage switchover.
Ongoing actions : A fix in progress.

item.title: [RBX2A][Hosted private Cloud] - Additionnal Zpool

End Time : 19/07/2022 10:05 UTC
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2A
Root cause : Due to a maintenance operation on storage Switchover.

Jul 19, 08:10 UTC
Update - No impact on the production datastore is detected.
Only requests for additional zpools are affected by the incident.
Our teams continue to repair. We apologise for the inconvenience caused.

Jul 19, 04:08 UTC
Identified - Start time: 19/07/2022 02:42 UTC

Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2A

Ongoing actions : A fix in progress.

item.title: [Global][Hosted private cloud] - Maintenance upgrade host
item.description:
Jul 8, 18:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jul 4, 07:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jun 23, 22:52 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 04/07/2022 07:00 UTC
End time : 08/07/2022 18:00 UTC
Description:
Builds will be pushed to the host, put in maintenance mode, all Vms will be moved with Vmotion and last hosts will be rebooted .
If major update have to be done, it will be two successive reboots like this:
Host v6.0 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.5 : upgrade major to v6.7, reboot, then upgrade minor to the last build v6.7, reboot.
Host v6.7 : upgrade minor to the last build 19195723 if needed, reboot.
If hosts are already on 19195723, they will be skipped.
Service impact : If we meet an issue during the reboot of the host , it will be replaced. (20 min)
Service improvement : All hosts have to be upgraded frequently due to the VMware's matrix of compatibility and also due to the CVE.
We will only enterprise customers with VSAN hosts.
the boot order will be checked
89 hosts
Service impact : Hosts will be rebooted.
Service improvement: All hosts have to be upgraded frequently due to the VMware's matrix of compatibility and also due to the CVE.
